I am a Ph.D. candidate in Computational Applied Mathematics at Stony Brook University. My current research sits at the intersection of AI for Physics, AI for Finance, and Scientific Optimization.

  • Neural Operators & PDE Learning: Fourier/Convolution operators, diffusion‑based generative PDE solvers, and active‑learning strategies for sparse/partial observations (Poisson, Helmholtz, Darcy, and Navier–Stokes families).
  • Optimization & RL‑Guided Simulated Annealing: Quasi‑equilibrium cooling policies with theoretical guarantees, evaluated on challenging landscapes (e.g., Rosenbrock, Lennard‑Jones).
  • AI‑for‑Finance: Option‑driven volatility learning under partial observations, robust operator learning for pricing/hedging, and benchmark design for market‑microstructure‑aware forecasting.
  • AI‑for‑Drug/Materials: Physics‑guided generative models, pocket‑aware molecular optimization, and docking/MD‑consistent energy alignment.

I work closely with advisors and peer‑collaborators across applied math, ML, and domain sciences to develop theory‑grounded methods that also scale on HPC (Seawulf/NVwulf).
